Replies.Reply: An empty breeze blows across a deserted cemetery. We hear the sound of FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING, then nineteenth-
The wounds suffered from love and failed friendships don't heal like a human's, but seem to only gape larger. The longing to be mortal returns, a longing for finiteness.
I had hoped the sounds of the passing eras would fade out, and a kind of death might happen. A kind of forgetting where I would be healed from my wounds.
But as I lay there, the sounds didn't fade but grew with the world.

A new fearless attitude had possessed the world, brave and Godless. I began to wonder if it was not time to resurrect. But the thing that eventually brought me back -- the decisive thing really -- came like a bolt out of the blue.
Sorry, Grandpa!
Whether it was that first meal, the music, or the 100 years of rest, I'm not sure, but suddenly I was feeling better than ever. My appetite for living was voracious.
My old house.
It was hard to believe these beings were mortal -- so confident in their skin. Everything in my body wanted to be with them. I couldn't help myself.
Please don't stop.
The door, of course.
Your music woke me from the longest sleep. It's sublime. In two hundred years I've never heard anything quite like it.
You may call me the vampire Lestat.
It just rolled out of my mouth.
Your struggles are over.
All that you've ever dreamed of will be yours.
Your lucky day.
It was a bold move, I admit. But from that moment on, they were my friends, my children, my band.
Yes. But why hide it in this day and age? I've hidden in the shadows for centuries. It's time to share myself with the world.
Our label isn't complaining, no.
If you like, I'll give you a private demonstration in your hotel room tonight.
After calling one stone tomb home sweet home for so long, I like to experience as much diversity as I can. Wouldn't you?
Maybe I'm trying to resurrect a few old friends with my words.
I don't like repeating myself.
I imagine they are, yes.
Come out, come out, wherever you are.
See you all in Death Valley.
Come out, come out, whoever you are.
You.   No.
Yes, I'd say I'm down with that.
Oh, the sweet song of her blood.
I'll hear it in my head all night.
I didn't know you were religious.
Be careful, Roger.   Very careful.
Who are you? Do I know you?
I'm the lord of a great manor.
I'll kill you!
Chose me? For what?
I'm dying.
More!
Humanity?
We're murderers.
But why must we hide, Marius? We are the powerful, we are the immortal. We should walk fearless in the open!
So I could never know her?
Replies.Didascalie: (gazing at violin player as it sinks in)

Replies.Reply: So I can never be known?
My God, what have you done to me?
Not how to stay alive apparently.
Well, I can fix that.
Is it? And what else do you think you know?
Am I?   Tell me all about it.
Is that so?   What I do is art, is it?
Well, I'm not hiding now, am I?
Well, Talamascan, you're certainly a very clever librarian, aren't you?
Talamasca's been following me for years. I've never known one to be so brave. Or is it just foolish?
Go. I'm through with you. Your kind never satisfies my thirst.
What?
Clever, clever librarian.
No, Roger, you wouldn't have.
Yes.   For the moment.
Ah.   Yes.
No, thank you, Roger. I'll make sure they're taken care of.
I don't think we've met.
Of course you do.
I'm always hungry.
Mine eyes dazzle, she died so young.
It's a very old poem of mine.
Don't do that.
Are you ticklish?
I'm very ticklish.
I don't know.     Let's see.
Marius!
Would you like me to play for you?
More!
Let me go!
God, her blood is like liquid fire.
Who are they?
Release me!
Marius, please, just one more time. I felt the sun. The light, Marius, the light!
Until tonight. And she chose me!
I must have more!
Marius!
Marius!    Please!
Many times since, I have called to Marius. I howled into the night in loneliness and pain.
I hate bedtime.
And you. Still wearing the old fashions, I see.
How did you manage to slip through the 1950s in red velvet?
Don't think you missed much.
Elvis, yes.
I'd say a few pounds lighter.
Live and let live.
How did you find me?
Come, let me show you what it means to live in the light.
Out there. My fans. Thousands and thousands. They worship me.
With all my black little heart.
I only have myself.
What's that supposed to mean?
Good! I'm glad she's risen!     Let her come.
200 years and the same broken record.
Well then, it's every vampire for himself. Just the kind of rules I like. The rules you taught me.
I'd rather not exist at all than have to live eternally as a ghost.
Such reverence for mortals! Then you should have left me as one!
Said the vampire to his son.
Replies.Didascalie: (shakes his head with a dark laugh)

Replies.Reply: Ah.   Yes.
No, thank you, Roger.   We'll entertain ourselves.
You must be very keen to die.
The Talamascans have become quite stealthy. I didn't know infiltration was quite their style.
How did you find me?
Then why are you following me?
Last wishes. What's yours?
Replies.Didascalie: (smiles, in a whisper playing    with her)

Replies.Reply: I don't have time for this.
Maybe not.
You don't know what you're asking!
I'll know when I kill you.
Are we? I seek the light.     You seek the shadows.
Alright!
This may be painful for a mortal.
Close your eyes.    Don't breathe.
And now for my next trick.
Yes. For just a moment. But as the pain is more intense for us, so is ecstacy.
You see, we love our victims.
No, although the taste is so rich and sweet. Love is the essence of the dark gift. The connection is so much more satisfying, brief as it is, than anything else.
No 'relationship,' no commingling can ever reach the heights of that experience.
You want to know everything. You want to see what it's like. Then come! I'll show you.
Come closer, Jesse. You want to see? You want to know?
You see now? Are you ready?     Now do you want it?!
No.   Of course you don't.
Well I didn't grant your final wish.
It was an impossible wish to begin with. You see, I am unknowable.
Good-bye, Talamascan.
Jesse.
Come on, children.
After tonight, Death Valley will live up to its name!
You want more?!
This one's for those who've come for me!
Get out of here!
Had a King?
You?
Never.
Can we try that again?
Where are we?
You live here?
Why?
This is the reason you have risen?
Made me see.
Never.    She is my Queen.
She's nothing to me.
But, My Queen, you've forgotten my reward!
I left you one drop, my love.
Drink, my love.
I will never leave you again.
Charmed, I'm sure.
Unexpected?
Always.
Shall we go get a drink, love?
What the hell, Maudy.
Who the hell are you?
What the hell is this?
Think we can call that a night.
What the f-- How did you get in here?
Cool.   We got our very own vampire.
We rock.
I'm ready for Death Valley.
Lestat!    Lestat!
May I present the Vampire Lestat.
Hey, hey! We're gonna keep this short here! One at a time. You!
I didn't see you come in.
So this house is fine I assume.
We'll be here for what?    A week you think?
Do you want me to take them home later?
Sure. Right this way, girls.
They're getting pretty worked up out there.
I told you I don't know anything about it!
So, Lestat. You say you're a real vampire. Correct me if I'm wrong, but what I remember about vampires is you guys usually keep your identity secret.
Could you prove it? You know give us a demonstration of your powers?
And it doesn't hurt the record sales, huh? Your album just topped all kinds of sales records.
There are a lot of rumors flying around the internet about the hidden meaning in your lyrics, that you're giving away 'vampire secrets.' Something in all that?
Of the closet.
Your first and only concert's in Death Valley, just days away. Why just the one?
But these other vampires, aren't they going to be pissed that you're giving away their secrets?
Why not a demo at your own house?
Do you have anything to say to the other vampires listening out there?
Ah, Jesse. You want to come and play with us, don't you?
Soon, soon, little one. I'll make sure you're with us forever.
Jesse!
Jesse!
No!
I have reason to believe Lestat's the real thing. A vampire. And an ancient one.
It would appear that way. But have you listened to his songs?

'Where are you now? Back in the sailor's arms, somewhere in the back streets of Soho?' I tracked down the old leases in London. It turns out, in the late 1700's, there was a pub right in the backstreets of Soho called the Sailor's Arms.
And it had a reputation for dealing with black magic.
And most importantly, reports of people being lured there and subsequently attacked by bloodsucking fiends.
Here's where you could find the Sailor's Arms in old London.
And here is where it would be today. Of course the Sailor's Arms is not there anymore. That part of London is mostly old warehouses, meat-packing plants.
Yes, but right now there's only one place to get a drink -- of sorts. A private club -- in exactly the same place. The Waverly Arms.
Well, what happens at the Waverly Arms now makes the Sailor's Arms look like a Happy Meal at McDonald's.
It's a vampire coven. And Lestat's leading us to it.
But listen, if you look closely, you can see they're vampires. I'm sure of it. And Lestat's leading us to them and --
Interesting. Perhaps we should assign someone to observe --
Wait a second. Who took this picture?
I did.
Yes.   Last night.
Look, I know it was breaking protocol and I'm really sorry, it's just I think --
Hey, does it look like I got involved? That is not called involvement. That is called running.
But, Jesse, tell us, what did you see?
Vampires.   Gathering.   I'm sure of it.
You have to listen to Lestat's lyrics. They're amazing.
Right. That's the best part.
Fine. Well then, I guess I'll just have to go back and get better, more conclusive evidence!
Yeah, I'm great. I just found a vampire.
David. There's nothing else.
Wait a second. So you do believe me? You do think it's a vampire coven.
Replies.Didascalie: (stops in her tracks, turns back, gazes at him, amazed)

Replies.Reply: They're all nightscapes. The detail is amazing. Mid-1500s.
This man is in both.
Have you --
Marius?! From Lestat's lyrics.
What do you mean the original vampire?
David, you've been tracking Marius your whole life. Maybe he's out there waiting for you right now.
Don't you ever want to just go and find him and --
You do?
Thanks. What is it?
Thank you for this.
I am the vampire Lestat.
Sure, all the time.
You haven't seen the rest of my body.
Marius has the blood of the ancients flowing in his veins.
You know, it's like they say --
You saved me.
I know a lot of things.
Well I guess we've got that in common. Although I think I'm a little ahead in the race here.
'Mine eyes dazzle, she died so young.' It's about the girl with the violin, isn't it?
Does anything, Lestat?
I mean, what's the point of coming into the light if not to have someone really know you?
You want the world to see you're real, don't you, Lestat? Don't you? Well, here I am!
Lestat!
There's something you left out of your diary.
You kept her violin, didn't you?
After all, it's only human.
Jesus Christ.
You're right, David. The journal has everything in it.
I'm going to Los Angeles for the concert.
Lestat.
Akasha!
Then I figured out you simply have to look the part.
Are you granting wishes?
Show me what it's like to be you.
All a vampire has is time.
Right. The covens are coming for you.
I understand why you're doing it.
Don't kill me yet. Let's spend our last nights together. Share it with me.   Show me what it's like to be you.
That's right. You don't know what's in my head, Lestat. Do you want to?
Gee, Lestat, that's a great way to get to know someone. Here. I'll give you a preview. Coming attractions. This is what you'll find.
I don't care.
Do that again!
Did it hurt?
Love?    I thought it was the blood.
Do you like it?
Is she alright?
Lestat, no!
Lestat!    Wait!
Aunt Maharet?
And something happened there.
I thought I was like him.
I missed you so much, Aunt Maharet.
Replies.Didascalie: (gazes up at her a long moment)

Replies.Reply: But this is my home. This is where I belong. Why do you want to get rid of me so quickly?
Yeah.
Lestat!    Lestat!
Lestat!    Lestat!
And what about Lestat?
I don't believe that.
Lestat!
What has she done to you?
It's all right, Maharet.
It's what I want.   I am ready.
David, this is Lestat.
I told you I'd return with my findings. Here they are.
Please don't be sad. I'm where I belong. I'm happy now.
What's it like?
Do you want to find out?
Well, I guess this is good-bye.
Good-bye, dear friend.
Jesse.
My office.   Now.
How's everything? You alright?

You know we work in a really strange field? The supernatural is beguiling at times. It doesn't like to just be observed, it is only satisfied when it has drawn us in completely. I know cause I've felt these things myself.
It's not always easy.
Well, all I can say is you're really lucky you're not lying dead in a gutter with two holes on your neck.
Come back here. I'm gonna show you something.
What do you see?
Right. And what do you see in this one?
And I know it's a Dutch pastoral.
Right.   He's in all of them.
Carbon tested? Yes. The different paint samples are all authentic. All painted at the time of that particular style.
It's Marius, Jesse.
Yes, you were. Good work.
I've been personally tracing him for decades. My little obsession. The oldest vampire ever documented. The closest we've come to the original vampire.
No. Jesus, we are not talking about having a drink at the Dorchester, Jesse. You know that.
Yes. And I'll tell you something.
Oh you're gonna love this.
Lestat's diary. I found it some years ago. This is where you'll find the answers you need.
They don't need to know everything, right?
My pleasure. When I took you on as an apprentice, I knew it was the smartest thing I'd ever done.
I knew you'd appreciate its scientific significance.
What?   You are not! I forbid it.
Jesse, you listen to me very, very carefully now. You are no longer seeing things clearly. Your emotions are clouding things.
Jesse, wait!
How do you do?
Yes.
Yes.   Take care of her, Lestat.
Good-bye, Jesse.
You, no.
C'mon, man, she's waiting for me in there. She said she was putting me on the list. My name's Norman --
Lestat.    Welcome.
I'm unknowable by nature.
But you may call me Marius.
My companion. Someone to share my burden.
You've lost a great deal of blood.
Then drink.
Good, is it not?
Drink and live. You've been brave enough for one night, my son.
I'm talking about humanity.
Who could've predicted the Enlightenment? Or Hannibal and his elephants?
Careful.
Shhh. The life of a vampire is a life of discretion. We must sleep during the day, when we are vulnerable to the sun. Mortals must never know about us. It is forbidden, for the sake of all our kind.
Not unless you wanted to kill her.
Forget God. You're no longer in his realm. Now we must leave.
Stop her, Lestat!
You must!
I will not have you put everything at risk! You will mind our laws!
I see you still have a few lingering mortal emotions. They will serve you no good, Lestat.
What have you done, Lestat?
Lestat?
I don't think so, my little lord.
No. You've drunk the purest blood. Seen the oldest of things -- far too much for one as young as you. You've been unconscious for days.
She made you quite powerful.
Don't make me use this!
Lestat, listen to me! I have watched over Akasha and her King for 2000 years! They must never awaken!
Akasha and her King nearly drank this earth dry when they ruled over Egypt. They drank until they lost their will to drink.
If she were ever to rise, she would again desiccate the earth!
You are part of a great coven!
Lestat.
It is good to see you, Lestat.
Old habits die hard.
I slept.
Elvis.
You're bigger than he is now.
If someone doesn't get to you first.
If it were only so simple, my son.
Impressive. Reminds me of mad old Druids running around chanting in the forest. Very primitive stuff.
It's what you've always wanted.
Do you think of anyone but yourself?
It may be time to get ready for some company.
Can't you hear it? Or is the applause all you can hear now?
Akasha has risen. She has taken her King's blood. Absorbed his power. You've done it this time.
Don't you understand?   You must stop this concert!

No. Not the same! You've only known Akasha dormant. She too will find you. She is choosing her moment. She has come to destroy you, Lestat. And in her wrath, she will devour everything that moves. Mortal and vampire alike.
And you're taking everyone with you, you fool! We were once mortals, too. It is our heritage we protect!
You're a monster.
Pandora, Armand, it's been a long time. Khayman, Maharet, to what do I owe this honor?
I don't see how this solves things. This isn't thought through.
Maharet is right. It is Akasha we face now.
She's sucked the life out of her King like a praying mantis. I sense she is getting closer.
What happens to our Queen happens to us. If Akasha dies, we die as well.
Maharet speaks the truth.   It is our only hope.
Hello, David.
I must show you my new paintings sometime.
Akasha.
Then we weaken her. Drain her of almost all her blood, but leave her just one drop.
I will not.
My Queen, I will watch over you always.
Fantasma!! Teras!!
Wow. This is the coolest after hours club ever. You sure you don't want a drink?
Soon.
We've started our approach into L.A. You should fasten your seat belt.
He reminds me of someone I know.
Really? Is that what you're going to do?
Turn up the music!
Oh, I do love the 21st Century.
Why so surprised, my love?    You called, and I have come.
Never fear me, Lestat. Your wishes have all come true.
You have yearned for a companion to share eternity. You have cried out to the world. I have answered your call.
You are so bold, like your music.
He's no more. You are my consort.
You thought it was all you?
You have the ego of a king as well. I know you, Lestat. I know that you crave to have the world at your feet. I have come to give it to you.
Has your tongue lost its taste for blood?
But you didn't kill the mortal girl.
Instead you kissed her.   Now kiss me.
Be my King. Forget about everything else.
What's your answer?
We are home.
We live everywhere and anywhere we choose. The world is our garden.
Behold our Kingdom.
Why not?
They believed in nothing, now they are nothing. But you and I will change all that. We will give the world something to believe in again.
Come, my King.      We have a score to settle.
Then we shall change it back.
Yes. In the shadows. In silence.
Poor Maharet. Still trying to hold onto what I took from you.
You think you can change my will?
I want to hear it from every one of you. What will it be?
Don't tell me, you have feelings for these ridiculous mortals!
Do you love me?
Prove it. Kill her.
Just the same, I'd like you to kill her. For me.
I've had enough of this 'great family.' It's time to end it.
You still think to challenge me, Maharet?
Now.
Good-bye, great family.
Now, my children, remember your real family! Or else.
That's right. My King, you've just earned your crown.
You see how he obeys.    You will or you will all die!
That's enough, Lestat.
Lestat.    Enough.   Stop!
You kill me, you kill yourselves.
You like him, love?
All he's gonna remind you of soon is a pile of bones. We're gonna dismember him. Bleed him dry.
But she's disappeared. He turns. Akasha's behind him now. He stares at her. Her hips are gyrating, her body slithering. A moan escapes from him. Again, he moves to her, reaches for her. She laughs.
Marius, you've broken your oath.
Yes.   It will set an example.
No. We will contact the covens.
No. Armand is right. We will go to the concert and first see what she does. There may be no need for action.
But is there a way?   We don't know.
Marius, we understand your affection for Lestat, but your duty is to us!
We could always get rid of him right now.
When she opens herself to give her blood, she is vulnerable.
We survived!
No, she will live forever. She sleeps. She sleeps, and dreams of us.
He's quite the devil, isn't he?
His music moves my blood.
Is it true, Maharet?   Has our Queen really risen!
Yes. That's right. She and the covens will take care of that brat. We must go to the concert and pay our respects to our great Queen.
It's just like Nero's day.
There are too many of them!
We're damned no matter what happens.
His music mocks us, Pandora!
Keep your amorous thoughts to yourself. His music is a threat to all vampires. We will let the covens dismember him at his concert.
Yes. We've all felt her presence, even as she hides from us.
What does she want now?
Replies.Didascalie: (as others nod, acknowledging the truth of this)

Replies.Reply: But perhaps she has come to kill Lestat and then will go back to her slumber. That is our only hope.
Good!
If she dies, we all die.
She took Akasha's last drop, took Akasha's death into herself.
Don't be so happy, Pandora. I knew Akasha when she walked this earth. I was her slave. I am now her enemy. I know what she is capable of.
She knows only one thing. Taking pleasure in destroying life. She is already killing the young ones to build her strength.
If we act together, we have a chance to destroy her.
Yes! We must destroy her immediately! If she is not stopped, I'm afraid of what will happen to the entire mortal world.
Then so be it! We must take that chance.
We must destroy Akasha. For the sake of humanity! We must find her. Now!
How? With your own throat!
Then you go to the concert and you shall see!
And I thought the Ancients became wise with their years.
I don't want you to go, but you must.
You must be with your own, my sweetest girl. I'll always be watching over you.
Forever is a very long time.
Hello, my princess.
Yes. Oh, Jesse, I've missed you so much, but I had to keep this from you.
No. You are not. I was once mortal, too. My sister died before her child was one year old.
This is our family -- my way of coping with eternity. The labyrinth of life. The family teaches me the rhythms and passions of each age.
You are my most prized light. You are what keeps me connected to the world of the living.
When your parents died I took you to India to take care of you.
I stopped it from happening.    And I will again.
Jesse, you must stay away from Lestat. You must forget all about him.
Yes, I know about your new friend.
I know, but it is not who you are, not who you are meant to be. You have found that out now.
Jesse, you must forget about him.
Me too.
You will go home to London in the morning.
You were seeking answers. Now you have found them. The family is who you are.
You will go home to London tomorrow.
We see now what Akasha means to do. Rule as Queen again.
This is why we must fight Akasha!
For the sake of all mortals. She must be stopped, or the mortal world will end.
We can't take that chance.    We must finish her.
Perhaps.
Lestat has joined with Akasha. He is lost to us now. He is never coming back.
Akasha.
Akasha. The world has changed since you reigned.
We've found other ways to co-
I will not.
You will not touch her!
I beg you, spare this child.
Wait, Lestat! You must stop!
He sighs, pulls over.    Gets out.
Jesse pays the driver.    Gets out.   Gazes at Roger.
Why can't I stay with you?!
I want to stay with you forever.
Jesse moves to the front entrance, gazes at the walls surrounding the front gate.
Need a ride?
Jesse!
Yes!
You don't have a permit for any of these stunts!
